item.title: Last Post of the Decade
item.description: Well, I guess this is the last post of the decade. I’m listening to Lo-Fi and working on TEDx’s website right now. A fitting way to end the decade. Lo-Fi. I went to a market meant for electronics yesterday to buy some electronic components for the Music Reactive Desk Lamp I wanted to work on. I did buy some earlier, but for some reason, the LED Light Strip that I bought wasn’t working (it was showing random colors).

item.title: Tips Fedora 31
item.description: Okay, I got bored. Really bored. So what do all cool kids do when they’re bored? Change their OS, obviously ðŸ™„. Yes, I changed my OS. Again. Which makes it the 4th time I’ve formatted my computer this year (excluding my Desktop format). I was running Ubuntu 19.10 (Eoan Ermine) for around 2 months when I felt it to be a bit heavy and a bit buggy. I also had only one partition of 2Tb size which I couldn’t really shrink into multiple partitions becuase I encrypted it with LUKS2.

item.title: Pass, My New Password Manager
item.description: It seems as if I do everything but the tasks on my To-Do list. I’ve been using Firefox’s Lockwise (In-Built Password Manager) for a decent amount of time now and I decided that it was finally time to move on from an external password manager to my own password managing system. I started looking for Unix Password Managers and there were a few. After some consideration, I settled for Pass, a beautiful password manager that works on GPG and simplicity.

item.title: I Set Up a PiHole
item.description: Okay, so this wasn’t on my To-Do List but I really wanted to do this for a looong time… so I did it 5 minutes ago. A couple of days ago, I bought a Raspberry Pi 4 (1Gb RAM) and decided to set up a PiHole. Pi-hole is a Linux network-level advertisement and Internet tracker blocking application which acts as a DNS sinkhole, intended for use on a private network. is what Wikipedia says and that’s better than whatever I could have said.

item.title: Way Too Soon for a Next Post
item.description: Sigh, yes. I know. This is probably way too soon for a next post on my blog, but hey, I’m happy that I’m keeping up with Point # 1 of my To-Do list for this winter.         Anyway, the reason for this post is that I’m quite excited about To-Do list Point # 2. I’ve just spoken to the Professor about the project we’re going to be working on. We have a clear direction of what needs to be done this winter and most of next semester.

item.title: Init D
item.description: Okay, so I’ve been putting this off for a very long time, but it’s time I do it. I have the time, I’m bored, I’m alone in the library with no one to distract me, I have a hot cup of coffee, and I have good music playing on my headphones. I want this blog to be a place where I can jot down my ideas, make a To-Do list, and track my progress in discrete intervals of time.

item.title: Projects
item.description: These are the projects I have worked on / I am working on. These are displayed in random order. MemeTaker_Bot One of the first bots I developed. This bot was developed to fetch a meme from 4 defined subreddits and download the meme using wget. This program was called by my more, ambitious SuperUserBot_V2. It also makes sure that the meme has not been downloaded before. SuperUserBot_V2 This is the second version of my first Discord Bot.

item.title: About_Me
item.description: Name: Raghav NS Date Of Birth: 1999-Oct-30 Email: raghav170555@mechyd.ac.in Intro: I like to program. I started to code in 7th grade when I learnt BASIC after which I learnt C in 8th grade. 2 years later, I started learning C++ in 11th and 12th grade. I like anime, playing instruments, tinkering with electronics, listening to Lo-Fi and drinking juice. I want to set up a company and be an entreprenur… or do a PhD in Computer Science… or both.
